text.first: Virgin Galactic on July 11, 2021 carried out the first tourist suborbital flight with its founder, British billionaire Richard Branson on board.
text.second: Unity 22 was launched from Spaceport America in New Mexico using a VMS Eve carrier aircraft. It later separated from the carrier aircraft.
text.third: Virgin Galactic hopes that massive suborbital space flights will begin before 2022.

title: Blue Origin
subtitle: suborbital flight

text.first: On July 20, 2021, Blue Origin's New Shepard suborbital rocket launched a capsule with people into space for the first time in the company's history, with the richest man in the world, Jeff Bezos, on board.
text.second: New Shepard, 18 m high and 4 m wide, is a reusable spacecraft. The booster unit raises the pressurized passenger ship to a height of about 76 km. The momentum propels the capsule up into space.
text.third: After that, she descends to the ground under three parachutes. The launch vehicle is also returning home.

comments: cost 200-250 thousand dollars. even/odd or how lucky

title: Space X
subtitle: Or maybe the Moon or Mars?

text.first: In 2016, at the 67th Annual International Astronautical Congress, Elon Musk stated that the optimistic timeline is for the first flight to Mars in 2022 (cargo delivery).
text.second: Crewed flight - in 2024. The crew will arrive on the Red Planet in 2025-26. I started SpaceX because "I wanted to help bring down the cost of space travel in order to establish life on another planet."
text.third: If everything goes according to plan, then thanks to Musk, about a million people will be able to call themselves the inhabitants of the Red Planet by 2050. There they will be delivered by a flotilla of thousands of Starships.
